name: Quinoa, Spinach and Mushroom Salad
description: This is almost a classic spinach and mushroom salad, but it’s bulked up by the quinoa, which goes very well with the mix and is nicely complemented by the walnuts.
keywords: gluten-free, healthy, low cholesterol, low-sodium, vegetarian, quinoa, spinach, walnut, spring
recipeIngredient: 1 bag baby spinach, rinsed and dried, or 1/2 bunch spinach, stemmed, washed and dried
1 ounce feta cheese, crumbled (1/4 cup, optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Place the quinoa in a strainer and rinse several times with cold water. Place in a medium saucepan with 1 1/4 cups water and salt to taste. Bring to a boil, cover and simmer 15 minutes, until the grains display a threadlike spiral and the water is absorbed. Remove from the heat, remove the lid and place a dish towel over the pan, then return the lid to the pan and let sit for 10 minutes or longer undisturbed. Transfer to a salad bowl and fluff with forks. Allow to cool.
Add the spinach, mushrooms, walnuts, parsley and optional cheese to the bowl. Whisk together the dressing ingredients and toss with the salad just before serving.
